thread.title: Outside the Box
thread.title_full: Outside the Box - San Antonio Express-News

author: Terrence Thomas
title: Outside the Box
text:
From inside the lines to out, Express-News staff writer Terrence Thomas takes a look back and a look ahead at the high school sports landscape.
Figure this
5: Days until the University Interscholastic League permits high school girls basketball teams across the state to conduct its first after-school workout. The first day of the season is Nov. 9, and the UIL state tournament is scheduled for March 3-5 at the Alamodome .
11: Years since Clemens last made the UIL volleyball playoffs before securing a spot with its five-set victory over New Braunfels Canyon on Tuesday. In 2004, the Buffaloes lost to Reagan 25-15, 25-12, 25-13 in a Class 5A (now 6A) first-round contest.
20: Consecutive district volleyball losses for Wagner before defeating Judson 25-15, 19-25, 25-19, 25-19 on Oct. 9. It was the Thunderbirds ’ first league win since defeating San Marcos on Oct. 25, 2013. 52: Digs for Stevens junior Jasmine Jacinto in the Falcons’ 25-27, 25-19, 21-25, 25-10, 16-14 victory over Jay in District 27-6A play on Oct. 9. It was Stevens’ first league victory.
Odds and ends
Coming back: The TAPPS state volleyball tournament is returning to San Antonio.
The event will be Nov. 12-14, and will be hosted by South San ISD.
It will mark the sixth time in the last decade - 2006, 2009, 2010, 2011 and 2012 - that TAPPS will contest its state volleyball tournament in the Alamo City.
